content:
These are a collection of scientific research papers related to geology and earth sciences:

1. Large Igneous Provinces
2. Cretaceous tectonic evolution of South China: A preliminary synthesis
3. Lithospheric Architecture of the Lhasa Terrane and Its Control on Ore Deposits in the Himalayan-Tibetan Orogen
4. Multi-stage crustal growth and cratonization of the North China Craton
5. Reactivation of the Archean lower crust: Implications for zircon geochronology, elemental and Sr–Nd–Hf isotopic geochemistry of late Mesozoic granitoids from northwestern Jiaodong Terrane, the North China Craton
6. Continental collision zones are primary sites for net continental crust growth — A testable hypothesis
7. Ultrapotassic Mafic Rocks as Geochemical Proxies for Post-collisional Dynamics of Orogenic Lithospheric Mantle: the Case of Southwestern Anatolia, Turkey
8. The evolving nature of terrestrial crust from the Hadean, through the Archaean, into the Proterozoic
9. Hydrous melting of the martian mantle produced both depleted and enriched shergottites
10. Fluid and mass transfer at subduction interfaces—The field metamorphic record
11. Paleoproterozoic arc magmatism in the North China Craton: No Siderian global plate tectonic shutdown
12. The Grenvillian orogeny in the Altun–Qilian–North Qaidam mountain belts of northern Tibet Plateau: Constraints from geochemical and zircon U–Pb age and Hf isotopic study of magmatic rocks
13. Petrogenesis and tectonic significance of Paleoproterozoic meta-mafic rocks from central Liaodong Peninsula, northeast China: Evidence from zircon U–Pb dating and in situ Lu–Hf isotopes, and whole-rock geochemistry
14. Geochronology and geochemistry of the Paleoproterozoic meta-basalts from the Jiao-Liao-Ji Belt, North China Craton: Implications for petrogenesis and tectonic setting
15. Discovery of Neoarchean suprasubduction zone ophiolite suite from Yishui Complex in the North China Craton
16. Early Permian A-type granites from central Inner Mongolia, North China: Magmatic tracer of post-collisional tectonics and oceanic crustal recycling
17. Magmatic evolution of the Tuwu–Yandong porphyry Cu belt, NW China: Constraints from geochronology, geochemistry and Sr–Nd–Hf isotopes
18. Petrological insights into the storage conditions, and magmatic processes that yielded the centennial 2010 Merapi explosive eruption
19. Towards a new model for kimberlite petrogenesis: Evidence from unaltered kimberlites and mantle minerals
20. Geochronology, geochemistry and tectonic significance of two Early Cretaceous A-type granites in the Gan-Hang Belt, Southeast China
21. An integrated mineral system model for the gold deposits of the giant Jiaodong province, eastern China
22. Partial melting of metabasic rocks and the generation of tonalitic–trondhjemitic–granodioritic (TTG) crust in the Archaean: Constraints from phase equilibrium modelling
23. Paleoproterozoic crustal growth in the North China Craton: Evidence from the Lüliang Complex
24. Archean komatiite volcanism controlled by the evolution of early continents
25. Experimental pet
